t: Isaiah 60
The Glory of Zion
“Arise,*pn shine, for your light has come, and*ld the glory of the Lord*s rises upon you.
See,*ln darkness covers the earth and*ld thick darkness is over the peoples, but*ln the Lord*s rises upon you and*ld his glory appears over you.
Nations*ln will come to your light, and*ld kings to the brightness of your dawn.
“Lift*pn up your eyes and look about you: All*ld assemble and come to you; your*ln sons come from afar, and*ld your daughters are carried on the hip.
Then*ln you will look and be radiant, your*ld heart will throb and swell with joy; the*ln wealth on the seas will be brought to you, to*ld you the riches of the nations will come.
Herds*ln of camels will cover your land, young*ld camels of Midian and Ephah. And*ln all from Sheba will come, bearing*ld gold and incense and*ld proclaiming the praise of the Lord.*s
All*ln Kedar’s flocks will be gathered to you, the*ld rams of Nebaioth will serve you; they*ln will be accepted as offerings on my altar, and*ld I will adorn my glorious temple.
“Who*pn are these that fly along like clouds, like*ld doves to their nests?

Surely*ln the islands look to me; in*ld the lead are the ships of Tarshish, bringing*ln your children from afar, with*ld their silver and gold, to*ln the honor of the Lord*s your God, the*ld Holy One of Israel, for*ld he has endowed you with splendor.
“Foreigners*pn will rebuild your walls, and*ld their kings will serve you. Though*ln in anger I struck you, in*ld favor I will show you compassion.
Your*ln gates will always stand open, they*ld will never be shut, day or night, so*ln that people may bring you the wealth of the nations— their*ld kings led in triumphal procession.
For*ln the nation or kingdom that will not serve you will perish; it*ld will be utterly ruined.
“The*pn glory of Lebanon will come to you, the*ld juniper, the fir and the cypress together, to*ln adorn my sanctuary; and*ld I will glorify the place for my feet.
The*ln children of your oppressors will come bowing before you; all*ld who despise you will bow down at your feet and*ln will call you the City of the Lord,*s Zion*ld of the Holy One of Israel.
“Although*pn you have been forsaken and hated, with*ld no one traveling through, I*ln will make you the everlasting pride and*ld the joy of all generations.
You*ln will drink the milk of nations and*ld be nursed at royal breasts. Then*ln you will know that I, the Lord,*s am your Savior, your*ld Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

Instead*ln of bronze I will bring you gold, and*ld silver in place of iron. Instead*ln of wood I will bring you bronze, and*ld iron in place of stones. I*ln will make peace your governor and*ld well-being your ruler.
No*ln longer will violence be heard in your land, nor*ld ruin or destruction within your borders, but*ln you will call your walls Salvation and*ld your gates Praise.
The*ln sun will no more be your light by day, nor*ld will the brightness of the moon shine on you, for*ln the Lord*s will be your everlasting light, and*ld your God will be your glory.
Your*ln sun will never set again, and*ld your moon will wane no more; the*ln Lord*s will be your everlasting light, and*ld your days of sorrow will end.
Then*ln all your people will be righteous and*ld they will possess the land forever. They*ln are the shoot I have planted, the*ld work of my hands, for*ld the display of my splendor.
The*ln least of you will become a thousand, the*ld smallest a mighty nation. I*ln am the Lord;*s in*ld its time I will do this swiftly.”
